sentence.idiomatic: You're out of your mind--you even got the time wrong.
He always says I've lost my mind, I constantly forget to bring things.
Only a person with half a brain would get cheated that easily.
The time of the exam has already been set.
I'm not sure who the person who came looking for you yesterday was.
Are you sure you want to go with him?
I had better hurry and go tell her this news.
As soon as I saw them fighting, I quickly ran away.
The party is about to start, how come you still haven't run off to change clothes?
My mobile phone shut itself off because the battery was dead.
Her phone was off. I couldn't contact her all day.
Don't turn off your phone tonight, she might need you for something.
It looks as if he won't come today.
He quickly solved the problem, it seems like he is an expert in this area.
The sky is so dark, it looks like it's going to rain.
The campus beauty is also entering the beauty contest--so you definitely have no hope of winning.
His opponents are all so formidable, from the looks of it, he has no hope.
I have no hope of a promotion once again this time. I didn't achieve much last month at all.
Lately I'm always having financial setbacks--first my mobile phone was stolen, then my MP3 player fell into some water.
Sigh, today I had another financial setback. I got conned into going for a makeover, and spent 500 RMB.
The car getting damaged is no big deal--fortunately no one got hurt, I can just chalk it up to 'financial losses will avert disasters.'
Thanks driver. I don't need a receipt.
Oh. Take care, good bye.
Good bye.
You made it.
Ah! My phone. How could it be gone? Oh no! I must have forgotten it in the taxi! I've really lost my mind.
Are you sure? Use my cell to call it and see.
Oh.
Ring, ring, ring. Ring, ring, ring.
What is it?
No one is answering.
Then quickly, find your receipt. Call and find that taxi.
You're right. Yikes, I didn't take the receipt. What luck! I take it every time, today is the one time I didn't take it.
Then try calling again.
Hello. The phone you are calling is switched off.
Ah, it looks like it's hopeless.
It's still switched off?
Uh-huh. Another financial setback!

word.literal: to report an incident to police
